w:r.w:t: COMPLETE SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE: THE BATTLE-READY ANSWER
What Everyone Else Is Building (The Trap)
"AI-powered data quality agent that automatically scores and fixes your data!"
Black box ML that "learns" quality criteria
Why This FAILS in Production (VISA's Nightmare):
RBI auditor asks "Why did you accept this transaction?" Answer: "The AI thought it was okay" â†’ REJECTED
Same dataset scored 87 yesterday, 92 today â†’ "Which is right? Why did it change?"
Data quality failure leads to fraud loss â†’ "Who's responsible? The AI?"
Model trained on Jan data, by March it's scoring differently â†’ Silent degradation
Quality score drops, no one knows why â†’ Spend weeks investigating black box
"Your AI discriminated against our transactions" â†’ No audit trail to defend
â”‚ "Let the model figure everything out" â”‚
â”‚ [Data] â†’ [ML Black Box] â†’ [Score] â†’ [Hope It's Right] â”‚
â”‚ OUR APPROACH: Deterministic Foundation + Contained AI â”‚
â”‚ "Rules enforce, ML informs, Humans decide" â”‚
â”‚ [Data] â†’ [Gate 1] â†’ [Gate 2] â†’ [Gate 3] â†’ [ML Flag] â”‚
â”‚ STOP or STOP or STOP or PASS FLAG ONLY â”‚
â”‚ LAYER 1: INPUT CONTRACT LAYER â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Define what we accept â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: YES â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: CONTRACT_VIOLATION â†’ SAFE_STOP â”‚
â”‚ LAYER 2: INPUT VALIDATION LAYER â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Verify contract compliance â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: YES â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: VALIDATION_FAILURE â†’ SAFE_STOP â”‚
â”‚ LAYER 3: FEATURE / SIGNAL EXTRACTION LAYER â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Transform data into analyzable features â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: YES (if extraction fails) â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: EXTRACTION_ERROR â†’ SAFE_STOP â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Score quality + detect anomalies â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: NO (can only FLAG) â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: MODEL_FAILURE â†’ FALLBACK_TO_RULES â”‚
CRITICAL: Cannot reject, only FLAG for review
CRITICAL: Pure presentation layer, zero decisions
â”‚ LAYER 5: OUTPUT CONTRACT LAYER â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Structure results into standard format â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: NO (formatting only) â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: FORMAT_ERROR â†’ Use minimal safe format â”‚
â”‚ LAYER 6: STABILITY & CONSISTENCY LAYER â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Verify output stability across runs â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: YES (if unstable) â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: INSTABILITY_DETECTED â†’ ALERT + DEGRADE â”‚
â”‚ LAYER 7: CONFLICT DETECTION LAYER â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Check for contradictory signals â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: YES (if critical conflict) â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: CONFLICT_DETECTED â†’ ESCALATE_HUMAN â”‚
â”‚ LAYER 8: CONFIDENCE BAND LAYER â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Classify decision confidence â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: NO (classification only) â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: N/A (always produces band) â”‚
â”‚ LAYER 9: DECISION GATE LAYER â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Map scores+flags to actions â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: NO (this IS the decision) â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: INDETERMINATE â†’ Default to NO_ACTION â”‚
â”‚ LAYER 10: RESPONSIBILITY BOUNDARY LAYER â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Define where system authority ends â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: N/A (declaration layer) â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: N/A (clarifies human handoff) â”‚
â”‚ LAYER 11: LOGGING & TRACE LAYER â”‚
â”‚ Purpose: Immutable audit trail â”‚
â”‚ Can Stop Pipeline: NO (passive recording) â”‚
â”‚ Failure Mode: LOG_FAILURE â†’ ALERT ops, continue scoring â”‚
â”‚ FINAL OUTPUT + AUDIT TRAIL â”‚
â”‚ - Trace ID for full reproducibilityâ”‚
Define EXACTLY what data we accept (pre-flight checklist)
Schema + Policy Definition (not executable, just declaration)
File formats accepted (CSV RFC 4180, JSON Lines, Parquet v2)
- Required Fields: ALL columns required=true in schema
- Quality Thresholds: Completeness â‰¥ 95%, Accuracy â‰¥ 90%
If user provides data that doesn't match contract â†’
â†’ Immediate rejection before any processing
reviewer_note: "User must supply schema JSON before data quality analysis can begin"
Verify that actual data complies with declared contract
Column count mismatch: Header has 12, Row 1523 has 15
Run checks in parallel where possible
Fail-fast on critical errors (don't continue parsing if encoding wrong)
Sample-based validation for large files (check every Nth row for consistency)
Transform raw data into analyzable features (preprocessing for layers 4-5)
amount_rank_percentile = percentile position in sorted amounts
merchant_category_id = deterministic hash of category string
country_code_numeric = ISO country to numeric mapping
transaction_velocity_24h = count of transactions in last 24h for this card
merchant_frequency = how often this merchant appears in dataset
Same input data â†’ exactly same features every time
All transformations use fixed parameters (mean/std from frozen reference dataset)
Every feature value logged for traceability
IF feature extraction fails (e.g., missing reference statistics):
A) Use partial features + flag incomplete
B) SAFE_STOP if critical features unavailable
â†’ Decision: Based on which layer needs the feature
- Layer 4.1-4.3 don't need these â†’ Continue
- Layer 4.4 anomaly detection needs them â†’ Degrade to rules-only mode
warning_details: "Baseline statistics unavailable for 47 cards (new customers)"
degradation_mode: "Temporal features skipped, anomaly detection uses statistical only"
LAYER 4: MODEL INFERENCE LAYER (AI CONTAINMENT ZONE)
This layer performs the "AI" work but is
Layers 4.1-4.3 are DETERMINISTIC and can REJECT
Layer 4.4 is ML-based but can only FLAG
Layer 4.5 is GenAI but is PRESENTATION ONLY
SUB-LAYER 4.4: Cross-Field Anomaly Detection (THE AI COMPONENT)
â”‚ WHAT ML MODELS CAN DO: â”‚
Score how "unusual" a record is (0-1 scale)
â”‚ WHAT ML MODELS CANNOT DO: â”‚
Output: Anomaly score per record (0=normal, 1=extreme outlier)
Model: Pre-mined rule dictionary (200 frozen rules)
Input: Current transaction + historical baseline stats
Model: Statistical deviation calculator (no ML, pure math)
Flags do NOT cause rejection. They attach to records as metadata.
Translate technical scores into plain English
You are a data quality analyst. Summarize this report for a business user in 3 sentences:

"Your dataset scores 78.5/100 and requires review before use. Completeness (92%) and Accuracy (85%) fell short of targets, primarily due to missing merchant emails and invalid country codes. Additionally, 12 transactions show unusual spending patterns and should be manually verified."
IF GenAI API call fails (timeout, error, rate limit):
â†’ Template: "Dataset scores {dqs}/100. {failing_dimensions} below target. {anomaly_count} records flagged. Action: {action}."
â†’ Impact: ZERO (scoring still valid, just less polished explanation)
All decisions already made by Layers 1-9
If GenAI says something wrong, decisions unchanged
GenAI has no access to change scores, flags, or actions
Standardize all results into fixed JSON schema
"technical_summary": "DQS=78.5 (50-75 band). Completeness and Accuracy deficits. 12 anomalies flagged.",
â†’ Include: trace_id, status, action, error message
â†’ Impact: Low (data still scored, just ugly output)
Detect if system is behaving erratically
1. Score Stability Test (if historical scoring data available)
IF this dataset was scored before:
â†’ Alert: "Same data scored {previous_dqs} last time, {current_dqs} now. Investigate model drift."
- High DQS but many critical violations (impossible)
- All dimensions pass but composite fails (math error)
- Anomaly score >0.8 but no flags generated (logic error)
â†’ Action: DEGRADE to safe baseline (use only Layer 4.1-4.3 results, ignore Layer 4.4-4.5)
â†’ CONFLICT (can't be high confidence with many anomalies)
â†’ Action: DEGRADE to deterministic-only mode
historical_comparison: "No previous score for this dataset"
Resolution: CRITICAL violations override high scores
Action: ESCALATE_HUMAN (conflicting signals, manual review required)
Resolution: Multiple near-boundary signals = LOW CONFIDENCE
Action: REVIEW_REQUIRED (too close to call automatically)
Conflict Type C: "AI Disagrees with Rules"
Resolution: Rules have authority, ML informs only
Action: SAFE_TO_USE (rules approve) + FLAG (ML suspicious) â†’ "PROCEED_WITH_CAUTION"
Reasoning: "Data meets all defined quality rules, but exhibits unusual statistical patterns. Recommend spot-check review."
4. User Threshold vs System Recommendation Conflicts
Conflict Type D: "User Set Low Bar"
) Actual Completeness: 72% (passes user threshold) System recommendation: 95% for regulatory compliance
Resolution: Warn user but honor their threshold Action: PASS (user acceptance) + WARNING ("Below industry standard")

Priority 1: SAFETY (if any layer says CRITICAL_FAIL, pipeline stops) Priority 2: DETERMINISTIC RULES (Layers 4.1-4.3 override Layer 4.4) Priority 3: USER POLICY (user thresholds respected) Priority 4: ML SIGNALS (informational only)

trace_id: TR_20260104_103045_A1B2C3 layer: 7_conflict_detection timestamp: 2026-01-04T10:30:54.123Z status: CONFLICT_RESOLVED conflicts_detected: 1 conflict_details: { "type": "ML_vs_Rules", "description": "High DQS but anomalies detected", "resolution": "PROCEED_WITH_CAUTION", "rationale": "Deterministic rules passed, ML flags attached as advisory" }
**Purpose:** Classify how certain we are about the decision

â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ HIGH CONFIDENCE BAND â”‚ â”‚ Conditions (ALL must be true): â”‚ â”‚ - DQS_composite > 85 OR < 40 (clear pass or clear fail) â”‚ â”‚ - All dimension scores within 10 points of threshold â”‚ â”‚ - Anomaly flags â‰¤ 1% of records â”‚ â”‚ - No conflicts detected in Layer 7 â”‚ â”‚ - Semantic score > 90 â”‚ â”‚ Action: Proceed with decision (high trust) â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ MEDIUM CONFIDENCE BAND â”‚ â”‚ Conditions: â”‚ â”‚ - DQS_composite 40-85 (middle range) â”‚ â”‚ - OR 1-2 dimensions near threshold boundaries â”‚ â”‚ - OR anomaly flags 1-5% of records â”‚ â”‚ - OR minor conflicts resolved in Layer 7 â”‚ â”‚ Action: Recommend human review for borderline cases â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ LOW CONFIDENCE BAND â”‚ â”‚ Conditions (ANY triggers low confidence): â”‚ â”‚ - Multiple dimensions within 5 points of threshold â”‚ â”‚ - Anomaly flags > 5% of records â”‚ â”‚ - Critical conflicts detected â”‚ â”‚ - Semantic score < 80 â”‚ â”‚ - Model fallback occurred (Layer 4.4 or 4.5 failed) â”‚ â”‚ Action: Mandatory human review â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
15 points per dimension within 5 points of threshold
= 70 points â†’ HIGH 30-69 points â†’ MEDIUM < 30 points â†’ LOW

trace_id: TR_20260104_103045_A1B2C3 layer: 8_confidence_band timestamp: 2026-01-04T10:30:54.789Z status: CLASSIFIED confidence_band: "MEDIUM_CONFIDENCE" confidence_score: 58/100 deductions_applied: { "borderline_dqs": 20, "anomaly_percentage": 10, "dimension_proximity": 15 } recommendation: "Human spot-check advised"
**Purpose:** Map all signals into ONE of FOUR final actions
System Authority: Can be used without human review
Human Authority: Must be reviewed before use
Human Authority: Senior review + investigation required
Human Authority: Fix data and resubmit

START â†“ [Check Layer 1-3 Pass/Fail] â†“ FAIL â†’ NO_ACTION (structural failure, cannot assess quality) â†“ PASS [Check Critical Violations (Layer 4.3)] â†“ YES (critical semantic violations) â†’ ESCALATE (data logically inconsistent) â†“ NO [Check DQS_composite (Layer 4.2)] â†“ < 50 â†’ ESCALATE (poor quality) â†“ 50-75 (borderline) â†’ [Check Confidence Band] â†“ HIGH â†’ SAFE_TO_USE (rules say okay despite mid score) â†“ MEDIUM/LOW â†’ REVIEW_REQUIRED â†“ > 75 (good quality) â†’ [Check Anomaly Flags (Layer 4.4)] â†“ > 5% flagged â†’ REVIEW_REQUIRED (quality good but suspicious patterns) â†“ < 5% flagged â†’ [Check Confidence Band] â†“ HIGH â†’ SAFE_TO_USE â†“ MEDIUM â†’ REVIEW_REQUIRED (abundant caution) â†“ LOW â†’ ESCALATE (low confidence overrides good score)
IF state machine reaches ambiguous condition: â†’ Default: NO_ACTION â†’ Rationale: "When in doubt, don't act" â†’ Log: INDETERMINATE_DECISION event â†’ Require: Human to review raw scores and decide
Layer 4.2-4.3: DQS = 95, no rule violations Layer 4.4 (ML): Anomaly score = 0.92 (HIGH flag)
Action: SAFE_TO_USE + advisory_note("ML flagged unusual pattern, but all rules passed. Suggest spot-check.")
Layer 4.2-4.3: DQS = 78, minor violations Layer 4.4 (ML): Anomaly score = 0.15 (no flag)
ML didn't flag, but rules already caught the issue
Action: REVIEW_REQUIRED (rules drive decision regardless of ML)
Layer 4.2-4.3: DQS = 45, critical violations Layer 4.4 (ML): Anomaly score = 0.05 (ML says "totally normal")
ML opinion irrelevant (rules have veto power)
Action: ESCALATE (ML cannot override critical failure)

trace_id: TR_20260104_103045_A1B2C3 layer: 9_decision_gate timestamp: 2026-01-04T10:30:55.012Z status: DECISION_MADE action: "REVIEW_REQUIRED" decision_path: [ "Layer_1-3: PASS", "DQS_composite: 78.5 (borderline)", "Confidence: MEDIUM", "Anomaly_flags: 12 (0.22%)", "State: BORDERLINE_MEDIUM_CONFIDENCE", "Result: REVIEW_REQUIRED" ] rationale: "Data quality acceptable but not excellent (78.5/100). Two dimensions below target. Recommend human spot-check of 12 flagged records before production use." responsible_party: "Data Governance Team"
**Purpose:** Explicitly define where system authority ends and human authority begins
**Type:** Policy Declaration (not executable code, but documented contract)

â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ SYSTEM RESPONSIBILITY (What We Own) â”‚

â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ USER RESPONSIBILITY (What You Own) â”‚
Define schema manifest (declare what quality means)
Provide baseline data for anomaly detection
False positive management (system flags, you verify)
Model retraining schedule (system alerts drift, you act)
Edge case handling (system escalates, you investigate)

â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ OUT OF SCOPE (What We Don't Do) â”‚
Action: SAFE_TO_USE System Says: "Data quality meets your defined standards" User Decides: "Do I trust these standards for my use case?" Handoff: System provided assessment, user accepts risk

Action: REVIEW_REQUIRED System Says: "Data quality borderline, recommend human review" User Decides: "Which records to review, how deeply, accept or reject after review" Handoff: System identified need for review, user performs review

Action: ESCALATE System Says: "Data quality poor or critical issues detected" User Decides: "Investigate root cause, fix data, resubmit or accept risk" Handoff: System flagged critical issues, user investigates
Action: NO_ACTION System Says: "Cannot safely assess, structural problems present" User Decides: "Fix data format/schema, resubmit" Handoff: System stopped processing, user fixes input

*"This system is a decision support tool, not a decision-making system. It provides data quality assessment and recommendations based on rules you define and patterns it detects. Final accept/reject decisions are human responsibility. If bad data passes through, the accountability lies with the human who accepted it, not the system that flagged concerns. The system's job is to surface information; your job is to act on it."*

trace_id: TR_20260104_103045_A1B2C3 layer: 10_responsibility_boundary timestamp: 2026-01-04T10:30:55.234Z action_delivered: "REVIEW_REQUIRED" system_responsibility_fulfilled: true handoff_to: "Data Governance Team (user-defined)" liability_transfer: "System provided assessment, awaiting human decision" user_next_steps: [ "Review 12 flagged records", "Verify completeness issues in merchant_email column", "Decide: Accept with risk OR Fix data and resubmit" ]
**Purpose:** Create immutable, complete audit trail for every pipeline execution
**Log Format:** Structured JSON Lines (one JSON object per log entry)
"reasoning": "Transaction amount (â‚¹45,000) is 4.2Ïƒ above user's 30-day average (â‚¹850), and transaction velocity (7 in last 24h) is 3.5Ã— typical rate (2/day)"

"rationale": "Data quality acceptable (78.5/100) but not excellent. Two dimensions (Completeness, Accuracy) below target thresholds. 12 records flagged for unusual patterns. Medium confidence in assessment. Recommend human spot-check before production use.",
"next_steps": ["Review flagged records", "Verify completeness issues", "Make final accept/reject decision"]
Read-only for auditors, write-only for system
10. Final action and handoff to human
IF logging system fails (disk full, permission error):
â†’ Action: Continue scoring BUT flag result as "AUDIT_INCOMPLETE"
â†’ Recommendation: Do NOT use for regulatory-critical decisions
â†’ Store result in temporary memory, retry log write
audit_certification: "Complete audit trail generated. All decision steps traceable."
This is the actual execution flow for ONE record:
RECORD: Row 1523 (transaction_id: TX00045231, amount: â‚¹45,000, merchant: "Coffee Corner", ...)
â”‚ Completeness: All required fields populated
â”‚ Consistency: No business rule violations
â”‚ Integrity: merchant_id exists in reference table
â”‚ Record Score: 100/100 (all checks pass) â”‚
FLAG: Amount 22.5Ã— max_rational for category â”‚
â”‚ Geographic Consistency: IP_country matches declared
â”‚ Temporal Sequencing: No time travel violations
â”‚ SHAP: amount_zscore contributed 0.423 to score â”‚
â”‚ Rule Matched: "IF category='coffee' THEN amount<â‚¹2000" â”‚
â”‚ Decision: FLAG (high-confidence rule broken) â”‚
â”‚ Decision: FLAG_FOR_REVIEW (ML says suspicious) â”‚
â”‚ Format: Record packaged in JSON â”‚
â”‚ Stability: No contradictory signals â”‚
â”‚ Layer 4.2-4.3 (Rules): PASS (all format checks OK) â”‚
â”‚ Resolution: Rules have authority, ML informs â”‚
â”‚ Decision: PASS_WITH_FLAG (rules approve, ML advisory) â”‚
â”‚ DQS for this record: 92.5 (from Layer 4.2-4.3) â”‚
â”‚ Anomaly flags: 3 detectors flagged â”‚
â”‚ = 65 points â†’ MEDIUM CONFIDENCE â”‚
â”‚ 1. Structural OK? YES â†’ Continue â”‚
â”‚ 2. Critical violations? NO â†’ Continue â”‚
â”‚ 3. DQS score? 92.5 (>75) â†’ Good quality â”‚
â”‚ 4. Anomaly flags? YES (3 flags) â†’ Check confidence â”‚
â”‚ 5. Confidence? MEDIUM â†’ Recommend review â”‚
â”‚ Rationale: "Record passes all quality rules but exhibits â”‚
â”‚ unusual spending pattern. Recommend manual verify."â”‚
â”‚ Decision: REVIEW_REQUIRED (flag attached to record) â”‚
â”‚ System Role: Provided assessment with reasoning â”‚
â”‚ Human Role: Review this record, decide accept/reject â”‚
â”‚ Handoff Point: Record flagged, awaiting human judgment â”‚
â”‚ Complete log entry written with: â”‚
â”‚ - All scores (field, semantic, anomaly) â”‚
â”‚ - All reasoning (SHAP values, rule violations) â”‚
Reason: High-value transaction at low-value merchant category
Next Step: Human reviewer examines details
Symptom: CSV parser throws error, JSON malformed
Message: "File unreadable. Error at row X: [parse error details]"
Symptom: User didn't provide schema OR schema JSON invali
Symptom: User didn't provide schema OR schema JSON invalid
Message: "Schema manifest required but not provided. System cannot determine quality criteria without schema declaration."
Human Action: Create and submit schema manifest
Symptom: Schema declares column "transaction_id" but data has "txn_id"
Message: "Schema mismatch detected. Expected column 'transaction_id' not found. Found: ['txn_id', 'amount', ...]. Fix schema or data."
Human Action: Align schema with actual data structure
Cascade Prevention: Stops at validation gate
Symptom: File too large (>10MB) or too small (<100 rows)
Message: "File exceeds 10MB limit (actual: 47MB). For hackathon demo, use sampling. Production would use distributed processing."
Recommendation: "Sample 50K rows or split into batches"
Message: "File contains 23 rows (minimum: 100). Insufficient for statistical validity."
Recommendation: "Aggregate more data before quality assessment"
System Recovery: None (hard limits for demo)
Symptom: >50% of required fields are NULL/empty
Reasoning: "Data so incomplete it's unusable for any analysis"
â†’ Skip remaining layers (no point scoring garbage)
Message: "Critical data quality failure: 68% of required fields missing. This dataset cannot be used. Investigate data extraction process."
Human Action: Fix data pipeline at source
Cascade Prevention: Stops pipeline but provides diagnostic report
"recommendation": "Check ETL pipeline - massive data loss detected"

Reasoning: "Data might be synthetic/fabricated, but could be legitimate edge case"
â†’ Semantic score reduced by 15 points (85 â†’ 70)
â†’ Flag for investigation but continue scoring
â†’ Confidence band downgraded to LOW

Message: "Statistical anomaly detected: Amount distribution violates Benford's Law. This pattern appears in <1% of real transaction data. Possible causes: (1) Synthetic/test data, (2) Highly structured transactions, (3) Data fabrication."
System Recovery: Continue with warning flag
Cascade Prevention: Isolated to semantic layer, doesn't break pipeline
Symptom: 40% of records are exact duplicates
â†’ Semantic layer flags "data ingestion error likely"
Message: "Critical uniqueness violation: 40% duplicate records detected. This indicates a data pipeline malfunction (double-ingestion, loop, or merge error)."
- Largest duplicate cluster: TX00045231 appears 87 times
- Duplicate pattern: All duplicates have identical timestamps (suggests batch re-processing)
- Recommendation: "Check ETL job for re-run without deduplication"
Human Action: Fix data pipeline, deduplicate, resubmit
Cascade Prevention: Fails cleanly with detailed diagnostic
Symptom: 85% of transactions occur at exactly 2:00 AM
Actual: 85% at hour=2, <15% rest of day
â†’ Anomaly detector flags pattern as suspicious
â†’ Confidence band: MEDIUM â†’ LOW (unusual pattern)

Message: "Temporal clustering detected: 85% of transactions at 2:00 AM. Possible causes: (1) Batch processing timestamp, (2) Timezone conversion error, (3) Synthetic data. Does not fail quality checks but warrants investigation."
Human Action: Verify timestamps represent actual transaction time (not batch processing time)
System Recovery: Full scoring continues with flag
Cascade Prevention: Contained in semantic layer, doesn't propagate
Message: "Anomaly detection model unavailable. Proceeding with rule-based quality checks only. Results will be conservative (may flag fewer issues than usual)."
- DQS based purely on rule compliance
- Action: More likely to recommend REVIEW (abundant caution)
- Long-term: Restore model file, investigate corruption
System Recovery: Automatic fallback to deterministic mode
Cascade Prevention: ML failure doesn't crash pipeline, degrades gracefully
Symptom: Baseline statistics missing (user didn't provide historical data)
Detection: Layer 3 (Feature Extraction) notices missing reference data
1. Layer 3 extracts 23 features â†’ Only 15 available (missing baseline stats)
- Detector A (Isolation Forest): Runs with 15/23 features (trained on all 23)
4. Anomaly scoring uses only Detectors A+B
Message: "Baseline data unavailable for 3,847 entities. Behavioral deviation detection disabled. Statistical and pattern-based anomaly detection active."
- Reduced anomaly detection coverage (2/3 detectors vs 3/3)
- May miss behavioral anomalies (spending spikes, velocity changes)
Human Action: Provide historical baseline data for full functionality
System Recovery: Partial degradation (some detectors work)
Cascade Prevention: Isolated to anomaly detection, doesn't break pipeline
Symptom: Isolation Forest taking >10 seconds per batch (should be <3s)
Response: TIMEOUT â†’ Skip model, continue
1. Start model inference â†’ Set 10-second timeout
2. Timeout expires â†’ Kill inference thread
4. Skip anomaly scoring for this batch
Message: "Anomaly detection timed out (infrastructure issue). Proceeding with rule-based scoring. No ML flags generated for this dataset."
System Recovery: Automatic timeout â†’ fallback
Cascade Prevention: Timeout isolated, doesn't hang entire pipeline
- Track timeout frequency (if >5% of runs, investigate)
Symptom: SHAP values calculation crashes (bug in shap library)
Response: DEGRADE to non-explained anomaly scores
1. Model predicts anomaly scores â†’ SUCCESS (scores generated)
2. SHAP explainer attempts feature attribution â†’ CRASH
4. Provide anomaly scores WITHOUT feature contributions
5. Use fallback explanation: "Model flagged as anomalous (score=0.87) but feature contributions unavailable"
Message: "Anomaly flags generated but detailed explanations unavailable due to technical issue. Scores are valid; investigate flagged records manually."
- User sees: "Record flagged, score=0.87, reason: SYSTEM_COMPUTED"
Human Action: Review flagged records (even without detailed explanation)
System Recovery: Scores preserved, explanation degraded
Cascade Prevention: Explanation failure doesn't invalidate scores
Symptom: Isolation Forest returning anomaly_scores between 0.48-0.52 for all records
Response: FLAG model as unreliable, downgrade confidence
â†’ Model is not discriminating (all records look similar)
â†’ Possible causes: Feature distribution shifted drastically from training data
â†’ Action: Disable anomaly detection, flag dataset as "OUT_OF_DISTRIBUTION"
Message: "Anomaly detection model unable to discriminate patterns (all scores near 0.5). Data distribution differs significantly from training data. Reverting to rule-based scoring."
- Current data: Might be from different region, time period, or transaction type
- Recommendation: "Retrain model on similar data OR accept rules-only mode"
- Long-term: Retrain model on representative data
Cascade Prevention: Model unreliability detected and neutralized
Symptom: Decision gate reaches ambiguous state (edge case not covered)
Detection: Layer 9 (Decision Gate) - no matching state
State Machine: No clear path in decision tree
â†’ Rationale: "When system uncertain, do not act"
â†’ Escalate to human for manual decision
Message: "System reached indeterminate state. Multiple signals at decision boundaries. Human review required to interpret context."
- Decision tree trace (where it got stuck)
- Recommendation: "Human should weigh: X vs Y"
Human Action: Manual decision based on raw data
Impact: Requires human intervention (as designed for edge cases)
Cascade Prevention: Ambiguity doesn't cause random decision
Symptom: Layer 4.2 says SAFE_TO_USE, Layer 4.3 says ESCALATE
Layer 4.3: Critical semantic violation (temporal impossibility) â†’ ESCALATE
Rationale: "Despite good format compliance, data contains logical impossibilities"
Message: "Conflicting signals resolved: Critical semantic violation overrides high DQS score. Data logically inconsistent."
Human Action: Investigate semantic violation (e.g., refund before purchase)
Cascade Prevention: Priority rules prevent ambiguity
4.3 Threshold Calibration Error (User Sets Contradictory Thresholds)
Symptom: User sets Completeness threshold = 70% but marks all columns as required=true
Response: FLAG contradiction, ask for clarification
Contradiction: "Required" means mandatory, but threshold allows absence

Message: "Configuration contradiction detected: All columns marked 'required' but Completeness threshold set to 70%. This implies accepting 30% missing required data. Please clarify: (1) Are all columns truly required? (2) Should threshold be 100%?"
Human Action: Reconcile schema (either lower "required" strictness OR raise threshold)
System Recovery: Proceed with user settings but flag inconsistency
Cascade Prevention: Flags illogical config without blocking
4.4 Action Flip-Flop (Same Data, Different Action on Re-Run)
Symptom: Dataset scored yesterday â†’ SAFE_TO_USE, today â†’ REVIEW_REQUIRED
Detection: Layer 6 (Stability & Consistency) comparing to historical results
Run 2 (2026-01-04): DQS = 78.5, Action = REVIEW_REQUIRED (same data, hash identical)
- Check: Did thresholds change? (user might have updated schema)
- Check: Did model version change? (model should be frozen)
- Check: Did decision logic change? (code update?)
Message: "Decision instability detected: Same dataset produced different action on re-run. Investigating cause. Result flagged as UNDER_REVIEW until stability confirmed."
2. Model drift (should not happen with frozen model)
- If threshold change: Document and accept new result
System Recovery: Flag both results, require human reconciliation
Cascade Prevention: Stability check catches issue before decision deployed
Symptom: System runs out of RAM during Layer 3 feature extraction
c. Write partial results to disk
Message: "System resource limit reached. Processed 38,742 of 50,000 records before memory exhaustion. Partial results available. Recommendation: Process in smaller batches (20K records each)."
- Recommendation: "Split file into 3 batches for full analysis"
Human Action: Split data and reprocess in batches
System Recovery: Clean shutdown (no data corruption)
Cascade Prevention: Prevents crash, saves partial work
Symptom: OpenAI API returns 503 Service Unavailable
1. Attempt GenAI API call â†’ 503 error
2. Retry once with exponential backoff â†’ Still fails
Template: "Dataset scores {dqs}/100. {failing_dims} below target. {flag_count} records flagged. Action: {action}."
Message: "AI summarization unavailable (service outage). Using template-based explanation. All quality scores and decisions valid."
- Explanation quality: DEGRADED (less natural language, more templated)
Cascade Prevention: API failure isolated to Layer 4.5, no upstream impact
5.3 Disk I/O Failure (Cannot Write Audit Logs)
Symptom: Disk full, cannot write to log file
Response: ALERT + Store logs in memory temporarily
1. Attempt log write â†’ IOError (disk full)
6. If disk space freed â†’ Flush buffer to disk
Message: "CRITICAL: Audit trail cannot be written to disk (storage full). Results buffered in memory. Forensic traceability at risk until disk space available."
- Regulatory risk: If system crashes before flush, logs lost
- URGENT: Flush buffer to persistent storage
System Recovery: Retry mechanism + in-memory buffer
Cascade Prevention: Logging failure doesn't stop scoring, but flags risk
- For regulatory decisions: HALT until logging restored
Symptom: System clock jumps backward (NTP sync failure)
Response: FLAG all timestamps as suspect
Message: "SYSTEM INTEGRITY WARNING: Clock skew detected. All timestamp-based checks flagged as unreliable. Recommend reprocessing after system clock corrected."
- Provide scores for non-temporal dimensions only
System Recovery: Detect and flag (cannot auto-correct)
Cascade Prevention: Isolates temporal checks, other dimensions valid
â”‚ AI components are GUESTS in a deterministic house. â”‚
â”‚ They can observe, advise, flagâ€”but NEVER decide. â”‚
â”‚ If AI fails, the house still stands. â”‚
â†’ Structural gates, format checks, feature extraction
â†’ Can STOP pipeline with authority
â†’ Rule-based scoring (7 dimensions + semantic validation)
â†’ Can REJECT data with authority
â†’ Falls back to rules-only if fails
â†’ Falls back to template if fails
â†’ AI signals are INPUTS, not authorities
Result: AI failure cannot break the pipeline
- ML anomaly flags (Layer 4.4) â€” ADVISORY ONLY
AI components are LEVEL 2-3 only (cannot stop pipeline)
Scoring continues with deterministic rules only
[FIREBREAK: Layer 4.4 Detector C disabled, A+B continue]
Flags still valid, just less detailed
[FIREBREAK: Default to stricter action (REVIEW vs SAFE)]
When AI Is Confidently Wrong (The Nuclear Scenario)
Scenario: ML Confidently Flags Clean Data
Record: Perfect transaction (passes all rule checks)
Why wrong: Model trained on urban data, this is rural spending pattern (legitimate but unfamiliar)
Detects: Rules say GOOD, ML says BAD
Conflict detected â†’ Confidence downgraded to MEDIUM
(Not LOW because rules strongly affirm quality)
Rationale: "Data meets all defined quality standards. ML flagged unusual pattern, but rules have authority. Suggest spot-check to verify legitimacy."
System: "Assessed as safe per your rules, flagged by ML"
Human: "Your callâ€”trust rules or investigate ML concern"
- Human can choose to investigate or accept
- Audit trail shows: "Rules approved, ML dissented"
ML being confidently wrong does NOT break the system.
Worst case: Extra review (false positive) not silent failure (false negative).
Layer 4.3: Semantic score = 75/100 (borderline suspiciousâ€”unusual but not impossible)
Why wrong: Novel fraud pattern not in training data
Flags: Domain rationality concern (amount high for category)
No conflict (ML agrees with borderline assessment)
Semantic layer's suspicion stands regardless of ML
DQS=82 (borderline-good), Semantic=75 (borderline-suspicious) â†’ Confidence: MEDIUM (not decisive either way)
Layer 9 (Decision Gate): Input: DQS=82, Semantic=75, ML_flag=NO, Confidence=MEDIUM State Machine Path: â†’ State: BORDERLINE_QUALITY_MEDIUM_CONFIDENCE â†’ Action: REVIEW_REQUIRED
Rationale: "Data quality acceptable but semantic concerns present. Recommend manual review."
Record sent for human review (DESPITE ML saying "fine")
Semantic rules caught suspicion (ML didn't need to)
ML's false negative didn't cause silent acceptance
KEY INSIGHT: Rules-based checks provide baseline protection. ML is additive (when it works), not foundational. System doesn't depend on ML being right.
Problem: Isolation Forest on 50K records takes 5+ seconds Impact: Dominates total pipeline time (80% of execution)

Optimization Strategies: A. Batch Processing: Process 1000 records at a time (parallel batches) B. Feature Pruning: Use top 15 most important features (vs 23) C. Sampling: For DQS assessment, score 10K sample + flag outliers in full dataset D. Model Simplification: Replace Isolation Forest with faster Random Forest (if accuracy acceptable)
Run ML anomaly detection on 10K representative sample
Flag top anomalies from sample for full-dataset review
Problem: Complex multi-hop rule chains expensive to evaluate Impact: Second-largest time consumer (15% of execution)
Optimization Strategies: A. Rule Indexing: Pre-compile rules into decision tree B. Early Termination: Stop evaluating record after first critical violation C. Parallel Evaluation: Run
independent rule chains concurrently D. Rule Prioritization: Check most-likely-to-fail rules first
Order rules by severity (critical â†’ warning)
First critical violation â†’ skip remaining checks for that record
Problem: External API call with network latency Impact: Unpredictable delay (10% of runs take 10+ seconds)

Optimization Strategies: A. Async Execution: Run GenAI in parallel with Layer 5-9 (doesn't block decisions) B. Aggressive Timeout: 3-second timeout â†’ immediate fallback C. Pre-generated Templates: For common score patterns, use cached summaries D. Batch Summarization: Summarize entire dataset once (not per-record)
Trigger GenAI call but don't wait for it
If GenAI completes in time, attach to output; else use template
Problem: Writing detailed logs to disk is slow (especially for 50K records) Impact: Can add 2-3 seconds to pipeline

Optimization Strategies: A. Async Logging: Write logs in background thread B. Log Compression: Compress JSON before writing C. Batch Writes: Buffer 100 log entries, write as batch D. SSD Storage: Use fast SSD vs HDD
Return results immediately (logs flush in background)
Original: 15-20 seconds for 50K records Optimized: 4-6 seconds for 50K records
Judge Talking Point: "We optimized for the 80/20 rule: ML model was 80% of time, so we sampled. GenAI was unpredictable, so we made it async. Result: 4Ã— faster without sacrificing quality."
**Problem:** Human reviewers overwhelmed by 2,500 flagged records (5% of 50K dataset)
Critical semantic violations (temporal impossibilities, logic errors)
Reviewer Time: Sample 10% = 225 records Ã— 1 min = 4 hours
TOTAL REVIEWER LOAD: Without prioritization: 2,500 records Ã— 3 min = 125 hours With prioritization: Tier 1+2 mandatory (11 hours) + Tier 3 sampling (4 hours) = 15 hours

FEATURE 1: One-Click Drill-Down Auditor sees: "Record TX00045231 flagged" Clicks trace_id â†’ Full decision chain: - All 23 feature values - All 7 dimension scores - All rule evaluations (pass/fail) - All ML scores + SHAP explanations - State machine path through decision gate - Final action + rationale

FEATURE 2: Reproducibility Proof Auditor requests: "Re-score this record" System re-runs IDENTICAL pipeline: - Same schema manifest (versioned) - Same model weights (frozen) - Same feature extraction (deterministic) - Same decision logic (FSM) Result: Identical scores (proves reproducibility)
RBI Compliance: "Yes, we can reproduce every decision"

FEATURE 3: Challenge Resolution Auditor: "Why did you reject record XYZ?" System provides: - Layer-by-layer execution log - Specific check that failed (e.g., "Completeness: merchant_email missing") - Threshold comparison (expected: 95%, actual: 94.8%) - Business rule violated (if applicable) - Human decision override (if applicable)

FEATURE 4: Statistical Summaries for Auditors Instead of reviewing 50K records individually: - "98.2% of records passed all checks" - "1.5% flagged for review (distribution: 60% Tier 3, 35% Tier 2, 5% Tier 1)" - "Top 3 failure reasons: Missing emails (45%), Invalid country codes (28%), Duplicate IDs (15%)" - "ML anomaly detection flagged 0.8% (397 records), of which 23% overlapped with rule violations"
Audit Efficiency: High-level overview â†’ Drill into anomalies only
**Primary:** VISA data governance teams, fraud analysts, compliance officers
**Secondary:** Any payment organization processing transaction data
*"This is for the person who gets called at 2 AM because bad data caused a regulatory finding. We make sure they can defend every decision."*
*"A five-layer data quality pipeline where rules enforce, ML informs, and humans decide. If anything fails, the system collapses to a safe stateâ€”never guesses, never hides problems."*
- 11-layer architecture with AI contained in ONE layer (Layer 4, Sub-layers 4.4-4.5)
- 7 deterministic quality dimensions + semantic validation + anomaly detection
- Every decision traceable via immutable audit logs
- 4 possible outcomes: SAFE_TO_USE, REVIEW_REQUIRED, ESCALATE, NO_ACTION
- NOT a replacement for human judgment
*"RBI fined a bank â‚¹10 crore for accepting transactions with incomplete KYC data. Their excuse: 'Our AI said it was fine.' RBI's response: 'Show us why.' They couldn't. We can."*
*"Most DQ tools fail silentlyâ€”scores drift, models retrain, decisions change. No one notices until fraud losses spike. We make failures LOUD and SAFE."*
*"When AI rejects a legitimate transaction, who's responsible? The data team? The ML team? The business? With our system: rules have authority, AI advises. Clear boundaries."*
*"In financial services, 'trust the AI' is not a compliance strategy. 'Trust the rules, informed by AI' is."*
- Before loading transaction data into analytics warehouse
- Before feeding data to fraud detection models
- "Why did fraud spike last week?" â†’ Run DQS on that week's data
- "Did we miss something?" â†’ Audit trail shows exactly what was checked
- Initial schema design (requires schema to exist)
### **WHERE** (Does it fit in the data pipeline?)
*"We sit at the loading dock, checking every shipment before it enters your warehouse. Bad data doesn't get inâ€”it gets flagged, explained, and sent back."*
*"You tell us what 'quality' means via schema manifest. We verify your data matches that contract. No guessing."*
*"Seven quality dimensions scored with pure math. Same input â†’ same score, every time. Regulators can audit the formulas."*
*"THREE frozen ML models look for unusual patterns. But they can't rejectâ€”only flag for you to review. AI informs, doesn't decide."*
*"GenAI translates technical scores into plain English. If it fails, we use templates. It's cosmeticâ€”decisions already made."*
*"All signals fused into ONE action: Safe/Review/Escalate/NoAction. We tell you EXACTLY why, then hand off. You own the final call."*
*"Every number, every check, every decisionâ€”logged immutably. RBI auditor asks 'why?' â†’ We show the math."*
Input: Clean dataset, 5,000 transactions Output: DQS = 96/100, SAFE_TO_USE Time: 4.2 seconds Judge Reaction: "Okay, it works. But what if..."
Setup: Corrupt the Isolation Forest model file (simulate model failure)
Explanation: "Anomaly detection unavailable. Proceeded with rule-based scoring. Results conservative."
Judge Reaction: "Wait, the AI failed but you still got a result?" Response: "Exactly. AI is a nice-to-have, not a must-have. Rules are the foundation."
"Notice: Scores unchanged. Action got MORE conservative (safe failure). System degraded gracefully."
Input: Inject a record that passes format checks but violates Benford's Law

Judge Reaction: "How did you decide which signal to trust?" Response: "Priority rules. Critical violations (like statistical fraud indicators) override high format scores. It's in the decision matrixâ€”auditable."
*"Everyone's building AI agents that fix data quality. We built something different: a system that STOPS when it's uncertain, EXPLAINS every decision, and lets HUMANS stay in control."*

*"Their AI learns. Ours doesn'tâ€”by design. Frozen models, deterministic rules, reproducible results. Because in financial services, 'the model changed' is not an acceptable explanation for a regulatory finding."*

*"We designed for failure. Five failure modes, five safe degradations. Model crashes? Fall back to rules. API times out? Use templates. Disk full? Buffer in memory. The system NEVER guesses its way through a problem."*
*"Our job: assess quality and recommend action. Your job: make the final call. If bad data gets through, it's because YOU accepted it despite our warningsâ€”not because we hid the problem."*

*"This isn't the fanciest AI you'll see today. It's the most BORINGâ€”and in production systems for payments, boring is a feature. Boring means predictable. Predictable means auditable. Auditable means defensible. And defensible means you keep your job when the regulator shows up."*

ARCHITECTURE: 11 layers, 5 sub-layers in ML inference zone
AI COMPONENTS: Contained in Layer 4.4-4.5 (15% of pipeline)
FAILURE MODES: 5 categories, all collapse to safe states
AUDIT TRAIL: Complete traceability via Layer 11 logging

PERFORMANCE: 4-6 seconds for 50K records (optimized) â”‚ â”‚ ACTIONS: 4 outcomes (SAFE / REVIEW / ESCALATE / NO_ACTION) â”‚ â”‚ CONFIDENCE: 3 bands (HIGH / MEDIUM / LOW) â”‚ â”‚ RESPONSIBILITY: Clear boundaries (system assess, human decide)â”‚ â”‚ REGULATORY: Compliance-ready (reproducible, explainable) â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
Confidence bands (know when to trust the system)
Others: "Our AI learns quality patterns" (black box)
Us: "Our rules enforce standards, AI detects outliers" (glass box)

WHY THIS WINS: Judges are senior engineers who've been burned by ML in production. They want: Reproducibility > Cleverness Stability > Performance Explainability > Accuracy Safe Failure > Risky Success
Fast inference (tree-based, O(log n) per record)
Too slow for 50K records, non-deterministic kernel computations
Deterministic (same data â†’ same rules every time)
No training phase during scoring (rules pre-mined and frozen)
Explainable violations ("Expected INR with UPI, got USD")
Probabilistic (not deterministic), harder to explain to non-technical users
100% deterministic (given baseline, deviation is pure math)
Zero training needed (just aggregate historical stats)
Transparent (user sees: "Your average is â‚¹850, this is â‚¹45,000 = 4.8Ïƒ")

"Create a requirements.txt file for a Python data quality pipeline with:
"Generate a JSON schema manifest for VISA transaction data with fields:
Include quality thresholds: completeness 95%, accuracy 90%, validity 99%."
Handle missing values by dropping rows. Ensure reproducibility with random_state=42."
"Write a Python script to train an Isolation Forest for transaction anomaly detection:
- Engineer 15 features: amount, log_amount, amount_zscore, hour_of_day, day_of_week, merchant_category_encoded, country_encoded, payment_method_encoded
- Print validation metrics (precision, recall) on 20% holdout
"Write a Python script to mine association rules from transaction data:
Include error handling for empty rulesets."
"Write a Python script to validate trained models:
- Check: Same input scored 3 times â†’ identical outputs (determinism test)
- Measure: Anomaly score variance across runs
Include timestamp and model hash in output."
1. File parseable (all rows have same column count)
2. Schema compliance (declared columns present, no extras)
- Raise exception on FAIL with clear error message
- Load frozen scaler and encoders from models/
- Return: feature_df (15 columns, same row count as input)
- Handle missing values: forward-fill then drop remaining nulls
* Accuracy: % values matching format (email regex, ISO country codes)
* Uniqueness: % duplicate-free in primary key columns
* Consistency: % rows passing business rules (e.g., end_date >= start_date)
* Integrity: % valid foreign keys (if reference table provided)
- Use fixed weights: Completeness 25%, Accuracy 20%, Validity 15%, etc.
- Load config/domain_knowledge.json with rational ranges per category:
- Check domain rationality: amount within max_rational for category
- Check geographic consistency: IP_country matches declared_country (if available)
- Check Benford's Law: leading digit distribution of amounts
